learning_outcomes.description: Understand what material indices are and explain how Material Indices relevant to a variety of applications can be determined.
Create and use Materials Selection Charts.
Select materials that optimises performance in a given application while meeting external constraints.
Understand what a Shape Factor is and use Indices which include Shape Factors to rank candidate materials for a given application.
Identify Multiple Constraints and the active (i.e. the most restrictive) constraint in a given application and apply material selection method to these scenarios.
Understand what exchange constants and penalty functions are and apply trade-off analysis using Compound Objectives/Materials Substitution.
Select materials rationally to meet environmental objectives by identifying the phases of product life, energy consumption in production and manufacture, and ways of disposal.

assessments.task_description:
The tutorial question sheet will be published in Blackboard before the tutorial session, in the folder "Tutorials". You will be solving the problem-based questions with the help of the tutors and the lecturer. The answers will be published in Blackboard a few days after the due day. 

T1: Use of Materials Selection Charts (weight: 5%)

T2: Material Indices (weight: 10%)

T3: Materials and Shape (weight: 10%)

T4: Multiple Constraints & conflicting objectives (weight: 10%)

T5: Hybrid Materials (weight: 10%)
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission of these assessment items must be through TurnItIn via Blackboard site to detect any possibilities of plagiarism or collusion with another student(s) or existing documents.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Materials Selection Project See details in Blackboard, Folder Laboratory Project.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The Final Exam is Closed-book with permitted material, and normally consists of a set of questions involving short derivations of material indices and the use of charts, and one or two exercises on Materials Selection related to existing components of, e.g., cars, aeroplanes, home appliances, bridges, musical instruments, sport goods, etc. (See examples of past exams at the library:https://www.library.uq.edu.au/exams/search.html).  Only the textbook hardcopy and Casio FX82 series or UQ approved and labelled calculator are allowed in the exam.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Watch lecture recording

The one hour lecture will cover the concepts, methodologies, formulations of material indices and case studies.
Lecture recording will be available before 9 am every Monday morning.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07
